#summary Implicit Methods

= EasyGSP Implicit Methods =



				
The following are accessible to every class, template and controller.
|| *Object* || *Description* ||
|| console(object) || Writes the object.toString() to the console window. Useful when developing ||



The following are only access to the templates and controllers
|| *Object* || *Description* ||
|| redirect(String url) || Sends redirect command to browser.||
|| forward(String uri) || Forwards processing to the specified uri ||
|| bind(String key, Object value) || Bind stores name value pairs in a scope similar to JSP's page scope.  Bind is normally used in a controller, to store variables that will be used be a template. When you store a value in request scope, to access it, you must write <%= request.key %>, if you store it using bind you could have simple said <%= key %>||
||toInt(String val) || Returns an Integer object for a string. ||
||toLong(String val) || Returns a Long object for a string. ||
||toDbl(String val) || Return a Double object for a string. ||
